intro: Gomphia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved gomphia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Gomphia parvifolia is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
